name: market for fibre, flax, long, scutched | fibre, flax, long, scutched | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/27915/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is the market for ' fibre, flax, long, scutched ', in the geography of Europe.;This dataset represents the transport of 1 kg of fibre, flax, long, scutched from the production farm to the place it is later used. No losses are considered in this dataset.;The product 'fibre, flax, long, scutched'  derive from a fiber crop that is an annual crop.

This activity starts at the gate of the activities that produce fibre, flax, long, scutched, within the geography of Europe.

This activity ends with the baling of fibre (long and short), to the consumers of this product.Transport is included. Product losses during transportation are assumed negligible and are therefore not included.
category: C:Manufacturing/13:Manufacture of textiles/131:Spinning, weaving and finishing of textiles/1311:Preparation and spinning of textile fibres

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The time period is the same as the in transforming activity for the same reference product.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data represent the situation in Europe.

exchanges.description: The data represent the scutching process for long fibre for EUROPEAN FLAX: western Europe - France, Belgium or Netherlands - amount for 3/4 of world production of flax fibre. EUROPEAN FLAXâ„¢ is a certification of origin and traceability owned by the Alliance for European Flax-Linen and Hemp (formerly known as CELC) which covers 100% of the fibres obtained from western European scutching, and guarantees third party verified traceability downstream.

exchanges.description: Transport distance based on US BTS Commodity Flow Surveys 1993, 1997, 2002, 2007, US Dep. Of Transportation, Bureau of Transportation Statistics. Of the total road transport, 6% is assumed to be by delivery van for goods with a large share of retail sale, and 3% for goods that are mainly sold via wholesale.
